summary: This is a formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking documentary evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein victim 'Katlyn Doe' for use in her civil case and the Epstein Victim Compensation Program. The letter lists 12 categories of requested documents, including photos, videos, correspondence, and financial records.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.context: Attorney from Edwards Pottinger LLC who is co-signing the formal Touhy request letter to the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking evidence for Katlyn Doe's case.

persons.name: J. Stanley Pottinger

connections.description: Edwards is representing Katlyn Doe in her civil case and is making this formal evidence request on her behalf.
Henderson is co-signing the evidence request letter as part of the legal team representing Katlyn Doe.
Epstein is identified as the perpetrator of sexual abuse against victim Katlyn Doe.
Indyke is a defendant in the civil case related to Epstein's activities, suggesting a professional or financial connection.

events.title: Formal Touhy Evidence Request Submission
events.description: Edwards Pottinger LLC submits a formal written request to the U.S. Attorney's Office for evidence related to Epstein victim Katlyn Doe.

events.title: Establishment of Epstein Victim Compensation Program
events.description: Mention of the ongoing Epstein Victim Compensation Program that Katlyn Doe is participating in.

events.title: Filing of Katlyn Doe Civil Lawsuit
events.description: Reference to the civil case Katlyn Doe v. Darren K. Indyke, et al., SDNY Case No. 1:19-cv-07771.

keyFacts: The law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC is formally requesting 12 categories of evidence from the DOJ related to Epstein victim Katlyn Doe under Touhy regulations.
The requested evidence includes photographs, videos, correspondence, gift/payment records, and documents showing Katlyn Doe's residence at 301 East 66th Street in New York.
The request is made to support Katlyn Doe's civil case and her claim with the Epstein Victim Compensation Program.
The letter specifically states they are not requesting investigatory records that would interfere with ongoing law enforcement proceedings.
The document reveals that Katlyn Doe's true name is known to the government but is being protected in this request.
